channel.title: Port forwarding error
channel.description:
I have searched the forum and i cant find an awnser to this so here it is, i go to portforward and it says: portforward of special application rule 7 conflicts with virtual server rule 16
and that stops me from portforwarding. Any solutions? i have a d-link 524 router and there is no tutorial for portforwarding a runescape server on portforward.com[br][size=1]Posted at: September 08, 2006, 09:19:50 PM[/size][hr]come on guys, i need ya help[br][size=1]Posted at: September 08, 2006, 09:59:40 PM[/size][hr]=.='

item.title: Port forwarding error

item.description:
@opm881 wrote:

kk, ill try just getting the port to forward[br][size=1]Posted at: September 10, 2006, 05:49:26 PM[/size][hr]ive portfowarded my broadband modem/router thingy but when i go to portfoward my router is says sumfin like error with rule 7 to 16 or sumfin like that to do with length? any help?[br][size=1]Posted at: September 11, 2006, 06:08:08 AM[/size][hr]bump o.O[br][size=1]Posted at: September 11, 2006, 07:07:53 AM[/size][hr]any help??

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding error
item.dc:creator: @smdskata smdskata
item.description:
@smdskata wrote:

Yes, just run a Cmd and type ipconfig. The local ip you get is the ip you enter into DMZ area. The only thing with DMZ it makes your computer easy to hack. I would work on just getting the port forwarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding error
item.dc:creator: @opm881 opm881
item.description:
@opm881 wrote:

dam it >.< yea, i tried to portforward my router but it will only handle ports up to 4 numbers, not 5 o.O and i made it so my windows firewall will let through the ports. also, my router has a built in firewall so i figured portforwarding would fix that but NOOOOO and i port forwarded on my modem and it also dont work >.<

item.title: Port forwarding error
item.dc:creator: @Ryu870 Ryu870
item.description:
@Ryu870 wrote:

just go to your firewall settings and click add port. Add the rs port 43594 and your server name and it should work. go to firewall<exceptions<add port

Read full topic
